prompt: <description>Part 1: A three-dimensional geometric shape with a rectangular base and a triangular top, connected by a straight line. The first part is a rectangular prism with a triangular prism on top, connected by a vertical line. Creating the coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Creating the 2D sketch Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane defined by the coordinate system. Drawing the rectangular base 1. Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.1348, 0.0]. 2. Draw a line from point [0.1348, 0.0] to point [0.1348, 0.6067]. 3. Draw a line from point [0.1348, 0.6067] to point [0.0674, 0.75]. 4. Draw a line from point [0.0674, 0.75] to point [0.0, 0.6067]. 5. Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.6067] to point [0.0, 0.3034]. 6. Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.3034] to point [0.0, 0.1264]. 7. Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.1264] to point [0.0, 0.0]. Drawing the triangular top 1. Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.1264] to point [0.0674, 0.75]. 2. Draw a line from point [0.0674, 0.75] to point [0.1348, 0.6067]. 3. Draw a line from point [0.1348, 0.6067] to point [0.0, 0.1264]. Creating the 3D model 1. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 2. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. 3. Extrude the 2D sketch to create the 3D model. Set the extrusion depth towards the normal to 0.1896 and the extrusion depth opposite normal to 0. The final shape The final shape has dimensions of 0.1896 x 0.75 x 0.75 units (length, width, and height).</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[-90.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.1348,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.1348,0.0],"End Point":[0.1348,0.6067]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.1348,0.6067],"End Point":[0.0674,0.75]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0674,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.6067]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.6067],"End Point":[0.0,0.3034]},"line_6":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.3034],"End Point":[0.0,0.1264]},"line_7":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.1264],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.1896,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Construction of a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom Step 1: Creating the coordinate system Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and a translation vector of [0.4, 0.0, 0.0]. Step 2: Creating the sketch Create the first face (face_1) and the loop in this face using the following linear segments: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.1] * Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.1], End Point [0.15, 0.1] * Line 4: Start Point [0.15, 0.1], End Point [0.0, 0.1] * Line 5: Start Point [0.0, 0.1], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Create the second face (face_2) and the loop in this face using the following linear segments: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.1], End Point [0.15, 0.1] * Line 2: Start Point [0.15, 0.1], End Point [0.15, 0.3] * Line 3: Start Point [0.15, 0.3], End Point [0.0, 0.3] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.3], End Point [0.0, 0.1] Step 3: Scaling the sketch Scale the sketch with a scale factor of 0.75 in all directions. Step 4: Extruding the sketch Extrude the sketch upwards by 0.4 units (extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal) and do not extrude in the opposite direction (extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal). Part 2: Construction of a metallic tube-like shape Step 1: Creating the coordinate system Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and a translation vector of [0.1402, 0.0, 0.1248]. Step 2: Creating the sketch Create the loop in this face using a single circular arc: * Circle: Center Point [0.05, 0.05], Radius: 0.05 Step 3: Scaling the sketch Do not apply scaling to this sketch. Step 4: Extruding the sketch Extrude the sketch upwards by 0.2 units (extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal) and do not extrude in the opposite direction (extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal). Subtract the resulting solid from the previously generated part to perform a CutFeatureOperation. For both parts, ensure that the Loop is closed and that the face is completely bounded by this loop. The number of curves and lines in each loop, as well as the sequence in which they are formed, are specified in the given JSON data. The resulting shape of Part 1 is a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom, having a length of 0.4 units, a width of 0.75 units, and a height of 0.75 units. The resulting shape of Part 2 is a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom, resembling a metallic tube or pipe, having a length of 0.1 units, a width of 0.2 units, and a height of 0.1 units. After completing both parts, they will combine to form the final 3D model described in the given JSON data, which is a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center.</description>
